status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: The {{FileSystem}} and {{FileContext}} APIs are inconsistent in enforcement of umask for newly created directories.  {{FileContext}} utilizes configuration property {{fs.permissions.umask-mode}} and runs a separate {{chmod}} call to guarantee bypassing the process umask.  This is the expected behavior for Hadoop as discussed in the documentation of {{fs.permissions.umask-mode}}.  For the equivalent {{FileSystem}} APIs, it does not use {{fs.permissions.umask-mode}}.  Instead, the permissions end up getting controlled by the process umask.
fields.summary: RawLocalFileSystem#mkdir and create should honor umask

comments.body:
More details are in this comment from HADOOP-11321:

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HADOOP-11321?focusedCommentId=14230778&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-14230778

Note that this issue is targeted to 3.0.0.  I don't believe we can change the behavior safely on the 2.x line.  Applications may be relying on the existing behavior of {{FileSystem}}.

{color:red}-1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12687133/HADOOP-11347.001.patch
  against trunk revision 25a0440.

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    {color:green}+1 tests included{color}.  The patch appears to include 2 new or modified test files.

    {color:green}+1 javac{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    {color:green}+1 javadoc{color}.  There were no new javadoc warning messages.

    {color:green}+1 eclipse:eclipse{color}.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    {color:red}-1 findbugs{color}.  The patch appears to introduce 3 new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

    {color:green}+1 release audit{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    {color:red}-1 core tests{color}.  The patch failed these unit tests in hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common:

                  org.apache.hadoop.crypto.key.TestKeyProviderFactory
                  org.apache.hadoop.crypto.random.TestOsSecureRandom
                  org.apache.hadoop.fs.TestFilterFileSystem
                  org.apache.hadoop.security.alias.TestCredentialProviderFactory
                  org.apache.hadoop.fs.TestHarFileSystem

Checkstyle issue is related to file length which is not under the scope of this JIRA.

Thanks for looking at this, Varun.  I don't think we need to change the FileSystem base class.  This JIRA is about the local file system-- that's the FS that is having trouble with this, and that's the one that should change.
Ok...Will make the necessary change.
